Alasdair Monk

User Experience Architect & Product Design Leader

I’m a UX Architect with 12 years of experience designing, engineering and architecting superior user experiences, most notably for developers and technical audiences.

My skill set of design craft, storytelling, programming & technical knowledge helps me address problems, big or small. I am comfortable with the macro and the micro. From prototyping ambitious new features to creating visions for entire new product lines. I thrive on ambiguity, uncharted territory and starting something from scratch.

I'm on a mission to make computers more approachable by building things for makers. All too often computers become a hindrance to our creativity rather than conduits of it. My work aims to change that.
Side projects

I like to make stuff in my spare time, below are some of the things I'm most proud of;

  • Umbra — the missing mac app for dark mode
  • Pylon — powerful layout utilities for CSS
  • Royo — A self-hosted, configurable icons as a service server
  • Bind — An experimental design tool (2016, Retired)
  • Scribe — CSS documentation generator used in purple3 (2018, Retired)
  • Edamame — A GUI for Heroku local (2018, Retired)
